headline: Why Altcoins Withered Over the Weekend
summary: There hasn't been much movement in the current trade war.  This past weekend, it seemed investors were taking a break not only from work, but from investing in the crypto market.  A wide range of coins and tokens traded down over the period, not least because a key worry in the minds of many crypto investors isn't being relieved.

A wide range of coins and tokens traded down over the period, not least because a key worry in the minds of many crypto investors isn't being relieved.

headline: Why Dollar General Stock Was Moving Higher Today
summary: Walmart's plan to raise prices should benefit Dollar General.  Dollar General also has less exposure to tariffs than most other retailers.  Shares of Dollar General (NYSE: DG) were gaining today, seemingly in response to Walmart's announcement that it would have to raise prices due to tariffs.

headline: S&P 500's Home Depot, Lowe's Earnings Due As China Shipments Revive On Tariff Relief
summary: S&P 500 home improvement retail giants Home Depot and Lowe's report first-quarter earnings and revenue this week with analysts and investors looking for insight into inventory levels, the 2025 outlook and commentary on President Donald Trump's tariff policies.  Lowe's follows up early Wednesday with its own first-quarter results.  The analyst consensus pegs the S&P 500 giant's Q1 earnings declining 6% to $2.88 per share with sales off 2% to $20.94 billion.

headline: Some Retailers Will Need to Eat Cost of Tariffs, Says Cicarelli
summary: Scot Ciccarelli, Truist Equity Research managing director, says some retailers will have to eat the cost of higher tariffs and try to keep prices low. Several retailers, including Lowe's Cos Inc., TJX Companies Inc., and Ralph Lauren, are expected to post weaker earnings due to tariff-fueled economic anxiety and consumer pullback. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

headline: Trump said Walmart earned billions more than expected. Here's why that's preposterous
summary: President Donald Trump claimed over the weekend that Walmart (WMT) made “BILLIONS OF DOLLARS” more than expected last year. That’s not just wrong — it’s preposterous on multiple levels. In fact, you could say Walmart is one of the least likely companies in the world to deliver surprise windfalls.

headline: Trump to carry out tariff threats if nations don't negotiate in 'good faith,' Bessent says
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -President Donald Trump will impose tariffs at the rate he threatened last month on trading partners that do not negotiate in "good faith" on deals, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in television interviews on Sunday.  He did not say what would constitute "good faith" negotiations or clarify the timing to announce any decisions to return a country to the various rates Trump initially imposed on April 2.  Trump has repeatedly reversed course since then, notably on April 9, when he lowered his tariff rates on most imported goods to 10% for 90 days to give negotiators time to hash out deals with other countries.

raw.headline: Trump to carry out tariff threats if nations don't negotiate in 'good faith,' Bessent says
raw.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -President Donald Trump will impose tariffs at the rate he threatened last month on trading partners that do not negotiate in "good faith" on deals, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in television interviews on Sunday.  He did not say what would constitute "good faith" negotiations or clarify the timing to announce any decisions to return a country to the various rates Trump initially imposed on April 2.  Trump has repeatedly reversed course since then, notably on April 9, when he lowered his tariff rates on most imported goods to 10% for 90 days to give negotiators time to hash out deals with other countries.
